meanings.definition: In a manner that creates a three-dimensional effect
meanings.sent1: The movie was filmed stereoscopically, making the action seem to pop out of the screen.
meanings.sent2: She looked at the painting stereoscopically, trying to see depth in the flat image.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to disappear stereoscopically, as if it could jump out of reality.
meanings.sent4: The forest at night appeared stereoscopically, with shadows playing tricks on the eyes.
meanings.sent5: The virtual reality game was designed stereoscopically, immersing players in a lifelike world.

meanings.definition: Using a stereoscope to view images in three dimensions
meanings.sent1: The stereoscopically enhanced photos gave a realistic depth to the scenery.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed the stereoscopically displayed pictures at the museum, feeling like he could reach into them.
meanings.sent3: The old-fashioned stereoscope made the photos look stereoscopically cool, like stepping into the past.
meanings.sent4: Her view of the city through the stereoscopically focused lens was like seeing a miniature world.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of stereoscopically layered images created a mesmerizing visual experience.
